001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003import java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler;
004import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
005import java.lang.reflect.Method;
006import java.lang.reflect.Modifier;
007import java.lang.reflect.Proxy;
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.Arrays;
010import java.util.Collection;
011import java.util.Optional;
012
013import org.immutables.datatype.Datatype;
014
015import io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonDemographic;
016import io.github.ai4ci.config.Modification;
017import io.github.ai4ci.config.Scale;
018import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.PartialDemographicAdjustment;
019import io.github.ai4ci.functions.Distribution;
020import io.github.ai4ci.functions.SimpleDistribution;
021import io.github.ai4ci.functions.SimpleFunction;
022
023/**
024 * Many of these utilities could be switched for immutable datatype approaches
025 * which would use code generation rather than reflection.
026 */
027public class ReflectionUtils {
028
029        private static Object adjust(
030                        Object object, PersonDemographic demog, SimpleFunction ageAdjustment,
031                        Scale.ScaleType scale
032        ) {
033                if (demog.getAge() == Double.NaN) { return object; }
034                var factor = ageAdjustment.value(demog.getAge());
035                if (object instanceof Distribution) {
036                        var base = ((Distribution) object).sample();
037                        return SimpleDistribution
038                                .point(Scale.ScaleType.scale(base, factor, scale));
039                }
040                if (object instanceof Double) {
041                        return Scale.ScaleType.scale((Double) object, factor, scale);
042                }
043                throw new RuntimeException(
044                                "Attempt to scale something not a number or distribution"
045                );
046        }
047
048        private static String capitalize(String s, String prefix) {
049                return prefix + s.substring(0, 1)
050                        .toUpperCase() + s.substring(1);
051        }
052
053        /**
054         * Find the datatype mirror class associated with an interface annotated
055         * with @Datatype. This is used to find the mirror class for an interface
056         * that is implemented by an immutable or modifiable class.
057         *
058         * @param <X> the interface tyoe
059         * @param clz the class of the interface (or the immutable or modifiable
060         *            implementation)
061         * @return the datatype mirror class associated with the interface
062         */
063        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
064        public static <X> Datatype<X> datatype(Class<X> clz) {
065                var tmp = clz.getPackageName() + ".Datatype_" + clz.getSimpleName();
066                try {
067                        return (Datatype<X>) Class.forName(tmp)
068                                .getConstructor()
069                                .newInstance();
070                } catch (ClassNotFoundException | InstantiationException
071                                | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
072                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException
073                                | SecurityException e) {
074                        throw new RuntimeException("No datatype found: " + tmp);
075                }
076        }
077
078        /**
079         * Get a getter method by field name
080         *
081         * @param <X> the type of the field
082         * @param o   any object
083         * @param s   the name of the field
084         * @return an Optional containing the value of the field if it exists, or an
085         *         empty Optional if the getter method does not exist or is not
086         *         accessible.
087         */
088        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
089        private static <X> Optional<X> get(Object o, String s) {
090                try {
091                        return Optional.ofNullable((X) getter(s, o.getClass()).invoke(o));
092                } catch (IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
093                                | InvocationTargetException e) {
094                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
095                } catch (NoSuchMethodException e) {
096                        return Optional.empty();
097                }
098        }
099
100        private static Method getter(String s, Class<?> clz)
101                        throws NoSuchMethodException {
102                return clz.getMethod(capitalize(s.replaceFirst("^(get|set)", ""), "get"));
103        }
104
105        private static <X> Class<?> iface(Class<X> clz) {
106                if (!clz.getSimpleName()
107                        .startsWith("Immutable")) { return clz; }
108                var tmp = clz.getSimpleName()
109                        .replaceFirst("Immutable", "");
110                for (Class<?> iclz : clz.getInterfaces()) {
111                        if (iclz.getSimpleName()
112                                .endsWith(tmp)) { return iclz; }
113                }
114                return clz.getSuperclass();
115        }
116
117        /**
118         * Find the immutable (or modifiable) implementation version of an interface
119         *
120         * @param <X> the interface
121         * @param clz the class of the interface (or the immutable or modifiable
122         *            implementation)
123         * @return the immutable implementation of the interface
124         */
125        public static <X> Class<?> immutable(Class<X> clz) {
126                if (clz.getSimpleName()
127                        .startsWith("Immutable")
128                                || clz.getSimpleName()
129                                        .startsWith("Modifiable")) {
130                        return clz;
131                }
132                Class<?> immClz;
133                var tmp = clz.getPackageName() + ".Immutable" + clz.getSimpleName();
134                try {
135                        immClz = Class.forName(tmp);
136                } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
137                        throw new RuntimeException("No immutable found: " + tmp);
138                }
139                return immClz;
140        }
141
142        /**
143         * Initialise a class using a constructor and parameters
144         *
145         * @param <X>    the type returned.
146         * @param clz    the class
147         * @param params the parameters
148         * @return an instance of type X
149         */
150        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
151        public static <X> X initialise(Class<X> clz, Object... params) {
152                var paramTypes = Arrays.stream(params)
153                        .map(o -> o.getClass())
154                        .toArray(i -> new Class<?>[i]);
155                Throwable err = null;
156                for (Method m : clz.getMethods()) {
157                        if (clz.isAssignableFrom(m.getReturnType())
158                                        && Modifier.isStatic(m.getModifiers())
159                                        && Arrays.equals(m.getParameterTypes(), paramTypes)) {
160                                try {
161                                        return (X) m.invoke(null, params);
162                                } catch (Exception e) {
163                                        if (e instanceof InvocationTargetException) {
164                                                e.getCause()
165                                                        .printStackTrace();
166                                                err = e.getCause();
167                                        }
168                                        // didn;t work
169                                }
170                        }
171                }
172                if (err == null) {
173                        throw new RuntimeException(
174                                        "Cannot initialise " + clz.getCanonicalName()
175                                                        + ": no static factory method found"
176                        );
177                }
178                throw new RuntimeException(
179                                "Cannot initialise " + clz.getCanonicalName()
180                                                + ": factory threw an exception: "
181                                                + err.getLocalizedMessage(),
182                                err
183                );
184        }
185
186        /**
187         * Initialise an object based on class name, package and parameters
188         *
189         * @param <X>          the type of the object being initialised
190         * @param className    the name of the class to initialise. This can be a
191         *                     simple name (e.g. "MarkovStateModel") or a fully
192         *                     qualified name (e.g.
193         *                     "io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.MarkovStateModel"). If
194         *                     a simple name is provided, it will be resolved
195         *                     relative to the package of clzInPackage.
196         * @param clzInPackage a class that is in the same package as the class to be
197         *                     initialised. This is used to resolve the package for
198         *                     simple class names.
199         * @param params       optional parameters to pass to the initialisation
200         *                     method. The method will look for a static factory
201         *                     method in the target class that matches the parameter
202         *                     types and returns an instance of the target class. If
203         *                     no such method is found, or if the factory method
204         *                     throws an exception, a RuntimeException will be
205         *                     thrown.
206         * @return an instance of type X initialized by the factory method with the
207         *         provided parameters.
208         */
209        public static <X> X initialise(
210                        String className, Class<?> clzInPackage, Object... params
211        ) {
212                var base = clzInPackage.getPackageName();
213                if (!className.startsWith(base)) { className = base + "." + className; }
214                try {
215                        @SuppressWarnings(
216                                "unchecked"
217                        ) var riskModelClass = (Class<X>) Class.forName(className);
218                        return ReflectionUtils.initialise(riskModelClass, params);
219                } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
220                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
221                }
222        }
223
224        /**
225         * Reflection based configuration merging due to complexities working with
226         * mapstruct for nested immutables. The problem here is that nested
227         * immutables need to be merged by constructing new immutables but mapstruct
228         * assumes they can be merged directly using javabeans. By providing this
229         * method we can merge nested immutables by recursively merging them using
230         * builders, but we can still use mapstruct to merge the top level objects
231         * using javabeans. This could be substituted by a mirror based approach with
232         * immutables datatype.
233         *
234         * <p>
235         * Merging means overwriting the base values with those from the modifier
236         *
237         * @param <X>      the type of the object being merged
238         * @param base     the base object to merge into
239         * @param modifier the modifications to apply to the base object. Any
240         *                 non-null fields will be merged into the base object. If a
241         *                 field is itself an immutable object and the modifier
242         *                 provides a modification for it, then the merge will be
243         *                 applied recursively to that field. For collections, the
244         *                 modifier's collection will be added to the base collection
245         *                 (if present) rather than replacing it.
246         * @return a new object of type X with the modifications applied.
247         */
248        @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
249        public static <X> X merge(X base, Modification<? extends X> modifier) {
250                try {
251                        Class<?> immClz = immutable(base.getClass());
252                        Class<?> builderClz = immClz.getMethod("builder")
253                                .getReturnType();
254                        var builder = immClz.getMethod("builder")
255                                .invoke(null);
256                        builderClz.getMethod("from", iface(base.getClass()))
257                                .invoke(builder, base);
258
259                        for (Method m : builderClz.getMethods()) {
260                                if (m.getName()
261                                        .startsWith("set") && m.getParameterCount() == 1) {
262                                        Optional<?> value1 = get(modifier, m.getName());
263                                        if (value1.isPresent()) {
264                                                if (value1.get() instanceof Modification) {
265                                                        Optional<?> baseValue = get(base, m.getName());
266                                                        m.invoke(
267                                                                builder,
268                                                                merge(baseValue.get(), (Modification) value1.get())
269                                                        );
270                                                } else if (value1.get() instanceof Collection) {
271                                                        Collection<Object> tmp = new ArrayList<>();
272                                                        get(base, m.getName()).map(o -> (Collection<Object>) o)
273                                                                .ifPresent(tmp::addAll);
274
275                                                        // TODO: Is adding to collections is a good idea e.g. if we
276                                                        // are overriding tests
277
278                                                        tmp.addAll((Collection<Object>) value1.get());
279                                                        m.invoke(builder, tmp);
280                                                } else {
281                                                        m.invoke(builder, value1.get());
282                                                }
283                                        }
284                                }
285                        }
286
287                        var builderBuild = builder.getClass()
288                                .getMethod("build");
289                        var out = builderBuild.invoke(builder);
290                        return (X) out;
291                } catch (IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
292                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException
293                                | SecurityException e) {
294                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
295                }
296
297        }
298
299        /**
300         * Apply demographic adjustments to a configuration object. This is similar
301         * to merge but instead of replacing values with the modifier's values, it
302         * applies a scaling factor to the base value based on the modifier and the
303         * person's demographic. The modifier provides {@link SimpleFunction}s that
304         * take the person's age and return a scaling factor. The base value is then
305         * scaled by this factor according to the specified {@link Scale.ScaleType}
306         * (e.g. multiplicative, additive). This allows us to apply age-based
307         * adjustments to parameters like incubation period or case fatality rate
308         * based on the person's age.
309         *
310         * <p>
311         * Modifying means scaling the base with the modifier either as an odds ratio
312         * or as a multiplicative factor (depending on the ScaleType annotation)
313         *
314         * @param <X>       the type of the object being modified
315         * @param base      the base object to modify
316         * @param modifiers the demographic adjustments to apply. This should be an
317         *                  object that provides SimpleFunctions for each parameter
318         *                  that needs to be adjusted, annotated with @Scale to
319         *                  specify how the scaling should be applied.
320         * @param demog     the person's demographic information, which is used to
321         *                  compute the scaling
322         * @return a new object of type X with the demographic adjustments applied.
323         */
324        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
325        public static <X> X modify(
326                        X base, PartialDemographicAdjustment modifiers, PersonDemographic demog
327        ) {
328                try {
329                        Class<?> immClz = immutable(base.getClass());
330                        Class<?> builderClz = immClz.getMethod("builder")
331                                .getReturnType();
332                        var builder = immClz.getMethod("builder")
333                                .invoke(null);
334                        builderClz.getMethod("from", iface(base.getClass()))
335                                .invoke(builder, base);
336
337                        for (Method m : modifiers.getClass()
338                                .getMethods()) {
339                                if (SimpleFunction.class.isAssignableFrom(m.getReturnType())) {
340
341                                        Optional<?> value = get(base, m.getName());
342                                        if (value.isPresent()) {
343                                                var ageAdjustment = (SimpleFunction) m
344                                                        .invoke(modifiers);
345                                                if (ageAdjustment != null) {
346                                                        var scale = m.getAnnotation(Scale.class)
347                                                                .value();
348                                                        var adjusted = adjust(
349                                                                value.get(),
350                                                                demog,
351                                                                ageAdjustment,
352                                                                scale
353                                                        );
354                                                        set(builder, m.getName(), adjusted);
355                                                }
356                                        }
357                                }
358                        }
359                        return (X) builder.getClass()
360                                .getMethod("build")
361                                .invoke(builder);
362                } catch (NoSuchMethodException | IllegalAccessException
363                                | IllegalArgumentException | InvocationTargetException
364                                | SecurityException e) {
365                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
366                }
367        }
368
369        /**
370         * Create a proxy for some interface that returns null or default value for
371         * any invocation.
372         *
373         * This is useful for testing and for creating stubs when we don't care about
374         * the actual implementation. For example, we can create a null proxy for a
375         * configuration interface when we want to test code that uses the
376         * configuration but we don't want to provide a real implementation of the
377         * configuration. The null proxy will return null for any method that returns
378         * an object, and will return default values for primitive return types (e.g.
379         * false for boolean, 0 for int, etc.). This allows us to focus on testing
380         * the code that uses the configuration without worrying about the details of
381         * the configuration itself.
382         *
383         * @param <X> the type of the interface to proxy
384         * @param clz the class of the interface to proxy
385         * @return a proxy instance of the interface that returns null or default
386         *         values for any method
387         *
388         */
389        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
390        public static <X> X nullProxy(Class<X> clz) {
391                return (X) Proxy.newProxyInstance(
392                        clz.getClassLoader(),
393                        new Class<?>[] { clz },
394                        (InvocationHandler) (proxy, method, args) -> {
395                                if (method.getReturnType()
396                                        .isPrimitive()) {
397                                        if (method.getReturnType()
398                                                .equals(Boolean.TYPE)) { return false; }
399                                        if (method.getReturnType()
400                                                .equals(Integer.TYPE)) { return 0; }
401                                        if (method.getReturnType()
402                                                .equals(Long.TYPE)) { return 0L; }
403                                        if (method.getReturnType()
404                                                .equals(Double.TYPE)) {
405                                                return Double.NaN;
406                                        }
407                                        if (method.getReturnType()
408                                                .equals(Float.TYPE)) { return Float.NaN; }
409                                }
410                                return null;
411                        }
412                );
413        }
414
415        /**
416         * Set a value by field name
417         *
418         * @param <X>   the type of the field
419         * @param o     any object
420         * @param s     the name of the field
421         * @param value the value to set
422         */
423        private static void set(Object o, String s, Object value)
424                        throws NoSuchMethodException {
425                try {
426                        setter(s, o.getClass(), value.getClass()).invoke(o, value);
427                } catch (IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
428                                | InvocationTargetException e) {
429                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
430                }
431        }
432
433        private static Method setter(String s, Class<?> clz, Class<?> type)
434                        throws NoSuchMethodException {
435                var sn = capitalize(s.replaceFirst("^(get|set)", ""), "set");
436                for (Method m : clz.getMethods()) {
437                        if (m.getName()
438                                .equals(sn) && m.getParameterCount() == 1
439                                        && m.getParameters()[0].getType()
440                                                .isAssignableFrom(type)) {
441                                return m;
442                        }
443                }
444                throw new NoSuchMethodException(
445                                "No match for " + clz.getCanonicalName() + "("
446                                                + type.getCanonicalName() + ")"
447                );
448        }
449
450        @SuppressWarnings({ "unused", "unchecked" })
451        private void copy(Object from, Object to, String s)
452                        throws NoSuchMethodException {
453                Optional<?> value1 = get(from, s);
454                if (value1.isEmpty()) { return; }
455                if (value1.get() instanceof Collection) {
456                        Collection<Object> tmp = new ArrayList<>(
457                                        (Collection<Object>) value1.get()
458                        );
459                        get(to, s).map(o -> (Collection<Object>) o)
460                                .ifPresent(tmp::addAll);
461                        set(to, s, tmp);
462                        return;
463                }
464                set(to, s, value1);
465        }
466
467}
